What about MP3s for monster creation?
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher DS Archive (DS): Japanese DS Games Archive: Monster Farm DS: Misc. Q&A (post all new topics here, we'll make more sections later): What about MP3s for monster creation?
By Lisa Shock on Friday, July 13, 2007 - 02:27 pm:

Could someone test out some random free, short MP3s and see if playing them makes the same monster each time?

If this works, we could just link to clips to make monsters.

By GM on Friday, July 13, 2007 - 02:36 pm:

Pretty much any audio format could work. I'll try it myself once my
game arrives.

By Rovest R. Yakuto on Friday, July 13, 2007 - 03:01 pm:

Not a bad idea.. though Timing is important, The game's catch for "start recording" is as soon as a sound plays. But holding a headset speaker to the Ds Doesnt work all the time and will not be the same as holding it to a normal speaker. You need an actual table top speaker for the same effect every tiem.. And again, you have to be loud enough to trigger the microphone if you use headsets..

Thus making some songs cause a monster recording few seconds later or much later.

Though i found by letting it randomly letting it record when the song hits a point. has gotten me more Varied Result in monster gathering then me actually saying a word or Drawing...

By Rovest R. Yakuto on Friday, July 13, 2007 - 03:26 pm:

thought about YouTUbe vids for this testing?
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=133KutDLcM8

for example?

It got me a
Tiger/Hengar 151/184
Pixie/ducken 129/184
Anubi/egg 4/184
Hare/? 80/184 Which looks like a Black bunny in a blues brother outfit
Plant/Ducken 141/184
Pixie/Tiger 136/184
egg/Dragon 121/184
Golem/? 71/184 Who looks like a Gundam/Macross spaceship in Golem Form
Plant/Pixie 145/184
Pixie/? 139/184 Looks like a shinobi woman from DOA
Golem/Mocchi 67/184

All from how the microphone picked up differnt parts of the Same Song
